intro: Phyllanthus wagapensis, commonly known as the Philippine spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, green leaves and clusters of yellowish flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, shaded areas within tropical rainforests. It has a woody stem and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
